content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  August 31 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'A' rating to Kimberly-Clark Corporation's (Kimberly-Clark) newly issued EUR500 million seven-year senior unsecured notes due September 2024. The Rating Outlook is Stable. The notes  senior obligations of the company  rank equally with all Kimberly-Clark's present and future unsecured and unsubordinated indebtedness. Proceeds will be used to repay a portion of Kimberly-Clark's ou

title: Fitch Rates Kimberly-Clark's EUR500MM Sr. Unsecured Notes 'A'; Outlook Stable

content: LONDON  Aug 21 (IFR) - Kimberly-Clark Corporation (NYSE: KMB) rated A2/A  a consumer product company with brands including Huggies  Kleenex  Cottonelle  Scott & Kotex  has mandated Deutsche Bank  Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley to arrange a series of investor meetings across Europe from August 28-30.

content: CARACAS Venezuela's socialist government said on Monday it was taking over and re-activating a plant that U.S. personal care products maker Kimberly-Clark Corp  halted due to the nation's economic crisis.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: Venezuela says taking over halted Kimberly-Clark plant

content: CARACAS  July 11 Venezuela's socialist government said on Monday it was taking over and re-activating a plant that U.S. personal care products maker Kimberly-Clark Corp  halted due to the nation's economic crisis.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: UPDATE 1-Venezuela says taking over halted Kimberly-Clark plant

title: BRIEF- Venezuela takes over Kimberly-Clark facilities after it stopped production  official says - AFP

content: CARACAS  July 9 Personal care products maker Kimberly-Clark Corp. on Saturday said it was halting its Venezuela operations due to the deteriorating economic situation that includes soaring consumer prices and shortages of basic goods.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: Kimberly-Clark halts Venezuela operations on deteriorating economy

title: Kimberly-Clark hit with investor lawsuit over medical gowns

content: SANTIAGO/LIMA  Dec 15 Peru's consumer regulator said Tuesday that it could sanction Kimberly-Clark Corp  with a fine of up to 12 percent of its earnings after competitor CMPC reported the two toilet paper companies fixed prices for years.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: UPDATE 2-Peru regulator probes toilet paper cartel  could fine Kimberly-Clark

content: SAO PAULO  Oct 22 Hypermarcas SA  the largest Brazilian producer of personal care goods  is in advanced talks to sell a unit that manufactures diapers to Kimberly-Clark Corp  sharpening the company's focus on pharmaceuticals  a source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: UPDATE 1-Hypermarcas  Kimberly-Clark in talks over unit - source

content: April 21 Kimberly-Clark Corp reported a 4 percent fall in quarterly sales as demand for personal care products such as Huggies diapers fell for the third straight quarter in North America and a strong dollar hurt sales in other markets.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: Kimberly-Clark's quarterly sales fall 4 pct

content: Feb 23 Kimberly-Clark Corp is transferring responsibility for payment of U.S. pensions to two insurers  a move it said would cut its projected benefit obligation by about $2.5 billion but result in a charge of $800 million in the second quarter.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: UPDATE 1-Kimberly-Clark to transfer pension obligations to insurers

content: Feb 23 Kimberly-Clark Corp said it is transferring responsibility for payment of pension benefits for its U.S. retirees to two insurers  reducing its projected benefit obligation by about $2.5 billion.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: Kimberly-Clark transfers U.S. pension benefit payments to insurers

content: CARACAS  Feb 13 Venezuelans puzzled over the impact of a complicated currency devaluation and fretted that dire product shortages in the OPEC nation's recession-hit economy would not go away.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: UPDATE 1-Shortage-hit Venezuelans scratch heads over complex devaluation

content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  February 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Kimberly-Clark  Corporation's (KMB) ratings as follows: --Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'A'; --Short-term IDR at 'F1'; --$2 billion commercial paper (CP) program at 'F1'; --$200 million dealer remarketable securities at 'A'/'F1'; --$2 billion revolving credit facility at 'A'; --Senior unsecured notes and debentures at 'A'. The Rating Outlook is Stable. Approximately $6.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: Fitch Affirms Kimberly-Clark's IDR at 'A'; Outlook Stable

title: Diaper wars: Kimberly to take on P&G through innovation  higher ad spend

content: Jan 23 Kimberly-Clark Corp is set to increase advertising and promotional spending for its diapers and launch new products in an escalating war with bigger rival Procter and Gamble Co in North America.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation

content: Kimberly-Clark Corp forecast a decline in net sales for 2015 due to a stronger dollar and weaker demand for core products such as Kleenex tissues and Huggies diapers in North America.

title: Strong dollar  weak demand weigh on Kimberly-Clark forecast

content: Jan 23 Personal care products maker Kimberly-Clark Corp reported a 1.4 percent fall in quarterly sales  hurt by weak demand for its core products such as Kleenex tissues and Huggies diapers in North America.
name: Kimberly-Clark Corporation
title: Kimberly-Clark sales hurt by weak demand in North America
